nodes.id: Memory in the Age of AI Agents: A Survey
nodes.description: Survey paper exploring the forms, functions, and dynamics of memory in AI agents
Public research university in Singapore where Guibin Zhang is affiliated
National university in Beijing, China where Yuyang Hu is affiliated
Public university in Shanghai, China where Shichun Liu is affiliated
Public university in Beijing, China where Yue Wang is affiliated
Singapore-based research-intensive university with strong AI and machine learning programs
Chinese university contributing to technological and computational research, including AI systems
Affiliated institution of some contributors to the survey on memory in AI agents
American public research university known for contributions to cognitive science and AI

nodes.id: Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (Guangzhou)
nodes.description: Research university in China focusing on interdisciplinary science and technology, including AI
Australian university involved in AI ethics and cognitive modeling research
U.S. research university with strong programs in robotics, AI, and agent architectures
Chinese technology company investing in AI research, particularly in mobile and edge intelligence
World-renowned UK university conducting foundational research in AI, reasoning, and agent memory
A core component of agentic systems that enables storage, retrieval, and use of information over time to support autonomous behavior and learning
AI agents built upon large-scale foundation models that leverage memory for complex decision-making and learning over time
The general notion of memory in autonomous agents, encompassing storage, retrieval, and utilization of information
Traditional cognitive-inspired memory classification based on duration of retention; often used in neural network architectures like LSTMs.
Refers to the implicit or explicit mechanisms by which large language models retain and use knowledge, often conflated with agent memory but distinct in scope.
A technique that enhances language model outputs by retrieving external knowledge at inference time; sometimes confused with agent memory systems.
The practice of designing and managing contextual information to improve agent performance and decision-making
A memory implementation that stores information at the token level, often within model inputs or context windows
Memory stored implicitly in model parameters, updated via training or fine-tuning processes
Memory represented in latent vector spaces, enabling compact and structured storage of learned experiences
The structural realizations of memory in agents, categorized into token-level, parametric, and latent memory.
The functional roles of agent memory, such as recall, adaptation, planning, and learning, going beyond simple temporal categorizations.
The temporal and behavioral characteristics of how agent memory evolves, including updating, forgetting, and retrieval patterns over time.
Functional type of agent memory that records factual knowledge from user and environmental interactions
Functional memory that accumulates experience over time to enhance an agent’s problem-solving capabilities
Short-term workspace memory used by agents to manage information during active task execution
The study of how memory is formed, updated, evolved, and retrieved over time as agents interact with environments
Standardized evaluation tasks used to measure the performance and capabilities of memory systems in agents
Publicly available software libraries and platforms designed to implement and experiment with agent memory systems
An emerging research direction focusing on designing memory systems optimized for autonomous operation and task automation
A machine learning paradigm where agents learn optimal behaviors through environmental feedback and reward signals
Memory systems capable of integrating and retrieving information across multiple modalities such as text, vision, and audio
A memory architecture in multi-agent systems where agents can access or contribute to a common memory space
Systems composed of multiple interacting agents that may collaborate or compete to achieve individual or collective goals
Challenges related to the reliability, safety, interpretability, and ethical use of memory systems in AI agents
Machine learning paradigm used to internalize reasoning and tool-use within agent models
Mechanisms that store and retrieve information for use in decision-making and learning processes in intelligent agents
Memory systems capable of handling and integrating multiple data modalities such as text, image, and audio
Memory infrastructure enabling information sharing among multiple agents in collaborative environments
Systems composed of multiple interacting intelligent agents working collectively or competitively toward goals
Challenges related to reliability, safety, interpretability, and ethical behavior in AI systems, especially involving memory
Autonomous, goal-directed intelligence capable of reasoning, planning, and acting with agency over time
Deep learning models trained on vast text corpora to understand and generate human-like language
Researcher affiliated with Peking University, contact author of the survey
GitHub repository curating research papers on agent memory systems
Academic survey paper synthesizing research on memory in agentic AI systems
Large Language Models serving as the foundation for AI agents
Intelligent systems powered by foundation models, capable of performing complex tasks autonomously
Researchers who contributed to the development or understanding of AI agents in 2025
Research group led by Minaee that contributed to AI agent advancements in 2025
Research group led by Luo that contributed to AI agent developments in 2025
Researchers who applied AI agents to deep research in 2025
Researcher or group of researchers contributing to the study of agentic faculties and memory in AI agents
Contributor to research on navigation in embodied settings
Research group led by Wei that contributed to scientific discovery using AI agents in 2025
A classification framework organizing agent memory by form, function, and dynamics as presented in Section 3, 4, and 5 of the paper
Academic preprint publication on arXiv dated December 15, 2025, in the field of Computation and Language (cs.CL)
Web-based platform used for version control and issue tracking, referenced here as a channel for feedback on the paper
A scientific discovery contributing to the advancement toward artificial general intelligence
Hypothetical form of AI capable of understanding, learning, and applying knowledge across diverse domains
Research work supporting progress toward artificial general intelligence
Research contributing to foundational understanding in the path toward AGI
An autonomous entity that processes information and makes decisions using memory mechanisms
Large language model serving as the foundational component for intelligent agents
Cognitive capability enabling logical inference and problem-solving in agents
Ability of agents to formulate sequences of actions to achieve goals
Capability allowing agents to interpret and understand environmental inputs
A core agentic faculty enabling AI systems to retain and use historical information for adaptation
Ability of agents to interact with external tools and APIs to extend functionality
Research demonstrating internalization of agent capabilities via reinforcement learning
Study showing how reinforcement learning embeds tool-use skills into model parameters
External architectural support structure that provides capabilities not fully internalized in the model
Framework transforming LLMs into adaptive systems that evolve through interaction with environments
Research illustrating how agents become learnable policies through environmental interaction
Researcher contributing to advancements in natural-language generation
Researchers focused on personalized chatbots requiring persistent memory in agents
Researcher involved in studies on natural-language generation and tool invocation
Researcher contributing to planning actions in autonomous agents
Researchers developing social simulations using agents with memory capabilities
Researchers applying memory-enabled agents in social simulation contexts
Researchers advancing AGI goals, particularly continual evolution through environmental interaction
Large Language Models, static in parameters but made adaptive through memory mechanisms
An AI agent capable of continual adaptation via environmental interaction, enabled by memory
Conversational AI application requiring proactive memory management for user personalization
System that uses historical user data and interactions to provide tailored recommendations
Domain where agents simulate human-like behaviors over time using stored experiences
Use case relying on agents’ ability to process and recall complex transaction histories
Field aiming to create artificial general intelligence with capacities like continual learning
Researchers who contributed to the understanding of continual evolution in AI agents through environment interactions, emphasizing the role of memory
A classification system for organizing agent memory research; current work argues for an updated version due to recent advances
Researchers who conducted a prior survey on agent memory systems, providing foundational taxonomies now considered outdated
Researchers who contributed earlier comprehensive overviews of agent memory, whose frameworks preceded key methodological advances
Systems that structure how agents store, retrieve, and utilize memories, including recent methods that extract reusable tools from past experiences
Reference to prior work on reusable tools in agentic systems, indicating established but underrepresented approaches
Reference to additional work by Qiu et al. on reusable tools, contributing to cumulative knowledge on tool reuse
Reference to research on reusable tools from past experiences, reinforcing the theme of underutilized methodologies
An emerging technique where memory augmentation improves agent performance during inference or deployment by dynamically leveraging past experiences
Research on memory-augmented test-time scaling methods, representing emerging trends in agent memory
Study on memory-augmented test-time scaling, highlighting advanced techniques for dynamic reasoning in agents
Software or methodological components designed for repeated use across tasks or agents, derived from prior experiences
Techniques that enhance agent performance during inference by dynamically accessing and utilizing memory
Type of memory storing factual knowledge, often used in agents to retain explicit data
Memory system capturing sequences of events or experiences, applied in agents for temporal reasoning
Memory for generalized knowledge and meaning, distinct from specific instances, used in higher-level agent cognition
The problem of increasing divergence and lack of coherence in the definition and implementation of agent memory concepts
A systematic classification framework intended to unify diverse concepts and terminologies in agent memory research
Proposed structured approach to reconcile definitions, integrate trends, and clarify foundational principles of agent memory
An autonomous agent built on large language models capable of perceiving, reasoning, acting, and adapting in dynamic environments
Mechanisms enabling large language models to retain and utilize information across interactions or within context windows
A framework combining generative models with external retrieval mechanisms to improve factual accuracy and context utilization
A conceptual framework for analyzing agent memory through its architectural forms, functional roles, and temporal dynamics
A core component in agent systems that stores and manages information across interactions and tasks
Retrieval-Augmented Generation, a framework combining retrieval and generation for improved reasoning and knowledge use in agents
A conceptual framework used to analyze agent memory through three dimensions: architectural forms, functional roles, and operational dynamics
The process by which new memories are created and encoded in agent systems
The process of accessing stored memories when needed for reasoning or action
The dynamic updating and refinement of memory over time through learning and experience
Research domain focused on how artificial agents store, retrieve, and evolve memory over time
A multidimensional framework for analyzing agent memory through its structure, purpose, and temporal evolution
A structured classification system for agent memory based on forms, functions, and dynamics
The process by which agents encode and structure information into memory representations
The process of accessing stored memory for use in decision-making or task execution, implied as part of the memory lifecycle
The process of integrating memory candidates into the existing memory base through consolidation, conflict resolution, and restructuring
An emerging research direction focusing on memory systems optimized for automated decision-making
Incorporation of reinforcement learning techniques to improve memory formation and usage in agents
Challenges related to the reliability, safety, privacy, and ethical aspects of agent memory systems
Standardized evaluation tools and datasets used to assess agent memory performance
Software or architectural frameworks supporting the development of agent memory systems
Autonomous systems powered by large language models that perform tasks and make decisions based on inputs and memory
Mechanisms that store, retrieve, and manage information within LLM-based agents to support learning and decision-making over time
Structural representations of memory such as episodic, semantic, and working memory in agent architectures
Functional purposes of memory including reasoning, planning, personalization, and long-term adaptation in agents
Temporal and adaptive behaviors of memory such as updating, retrieval strategies, forgetting mechanisms, and evolution over time
Emerging trends and open challenges in agent memory research guiding future innovation
Standardized evaluation frameworks used to measure performance and capabilities of agent memory systems
Publicly available software tools and platforms supporting development, testing, and deployment of agent memory solutions
Individuals conducting academic or industrial research on AI agent systems and memory architectures
Developers and engineers applying agent memory technologies in real-world applications
Part of the survey that examines the forms of agent memory
Part of the survey that examines the functions and dynamics of agent memory
Part of the survey that summarizes representative benchmarks and framework resources for agent systems
Part of the survey that discusses emerging research frontiers and future directions in agent memory
Conclusion section summarizing key insights from the survey on agent memory
Systems that use large language models as agents to perform tasks in an environment through interactions and decision-making
Component coupled to an LLM agent’s decision process through read/write interactions, supporting short-term and long-term memory functions
Agent memory function operating within a single task or trial, also referred to as inside-trial memory
Agent memory function operating across multiple tasks or trials, also known as cross-trial memory
The external context or system in which agents operate, characterized by states and transitions influenced by agent actions
The set of all possible states the environment can be in, denoted as S, forming the basis for state transitions
A probabilistic model Ψ that defines how the environment state evolves from one time step to the next based on current state and action
A decision or operation performed by an agent at a given time step that influences the environment's state transition
The information perceived by an agent from the environment at a given time step, dependent on the current state and history
The record of past interactions accessible to an agent, influencing its observations and decisions over time
An agent system with only one agent (N=1), such as ReAct, making decisions independently
A system involving multiple agents (N>1) that may interact through debate or planner-executor architectures
A single-agent framework that combines reasoning and acting for task-solving using LLMs
A multi-agent interaction paradigm where agents argue or discuss to reach better decisions
A multi-agent design where one agent plans actions and another executes them, improving task decomposition
Research work by Li et al. published in 2024 presenting debate-style multi-agent systems
Research study by Wan et al. published in 2025 introducing planner–executor multi-agent frameworks
A process where decisions are made one after another, often used in agent systems where one agent acts per time step
Coordination among agents achieved indirectly through changes in the shared environment rather than direct communication
An artificial intelligence agent powered by large language models capable of performing complex tasks through reasoning and interaction
The record of past interactions accessible to an agent, including messages, tool outputs, reasoning traces, and shared states
The formal definition of a task, including user instructions, goals, or constraints, treated as fixed during execution
The set of possible actions an agent can perform, which in LLM-based agents is often heterogeneous and structured
AI capability to generate human-like text for reasoning, explanations, responses, or instructions
Academic publication by Li et al. in 2023 contributing to research on natural-language generation in agent systems
Academic publication by Wu et al. in 2024 contributing to research on natural-language generation in agent systems
Academic publication by Hong et al. in 2024 contributing to research on natural-language generation in agent systems
Research publication by Qian et al. in 2024 describing collaborative agentic systems for software development
Actions that involve calling external tools such as APIs, calculators, databases, or code execution environments
AI-generated task decompositions, execution plans, or subgoal specifications to guide future behavior
Actions where an agent directly manipulates the external environment, such as navigation, code editing, or memory modification
Structured message-based interactions enabling collaboration or negotiation between agents
Researcher in the field of natural-language generation
Researcher working on natural-language generation systems
Researcher focused on tool invocation mechanisms in AI agents
Researcher studying tool invocation across multiple publications
Research group or project focused on AI planning and agent communication
Researcher in the domain of task planning and decomposition for AI systems
Researcher in embodied AI and environmental interaction
Researcher studying software repository manipulation by AI agents
Researcher in the area of environment control via code editing
Researcher focused on inter-agent communication and structured messaging
Application Programming Interfaces used as external tools by AI systems
External information retrieval systems invoked by AI agents
Tools used by AI agents for mathematical computation
External data storage systems accessed through tool invocation
Virtual environments used for testing or interacting with AI agents
Sandboxed runtimes enabling AI agents to execute generated code
Task of moving through physical or virtual embodied environments
Modification of source code or project files within a version-controlled repository
Collaborative memory space that can be modified by agents for state sharing
Authors of a study on agent communication and collaboration through structured messages using LLMs
Joint effort between agents to achieve shared goals through interaction
Process by which agents reach agreements through structured communication
Large language model that generates outputs sequentially based on previous tokens and context
Decision-making function π that maps observations and memory to actions for an agent
Internal representation mi_t derived from an agent's memory, used in policy computation
Internal cognitive process where agents perform sequential logical or computational steps before acting
Unobserved internal decision-making process within an agent prior to action emission
Internal working memory operations used during reasoning, not exposed in final output
Sequence of steps involving observation, memory retrieval, and action execution in multi-agent systems
Complete sequence of states, observations, and actions over time: τ = (s0, o0, a0, s1, o1, a1, ..., sT)
Perceptual input ot received by an agent from its environment at time t
Optional process by which an agent accesses stored information to inform current decisions
Full run of the multi-agent system resulting in a complete interaction trajectory
A class of systems characterized by autonomous behavior, involving observation, reasoning, memory, and action to achieve goals
The process by which an agent perceives its current state or context, serving as input for decision-making
Reasoning and processing performed by large language models as part of an agent's cognitive loop
The execution of decisions that affect the environment and drive transitions to new states
The change in an agent's environment or internal condition resulting from action execution
A unified system that maintains and updates a memory state over time, integrating past experiences into agent decision-making
Historical engagements of the agent within current or previous tasks, forming the basis of memory
The cognitive process of selecting actions based on observations, memory, and reasoning
Research publication by Wang et al. in 2025 (variant k) on agentic collaboration in complex tasks
Research by Weng et al. in 2025 on agentic systems applied to scientific inquiry
A flexible memory system for agents that maintains an evolving memory state across tasks, supporting both cross-trial and task-specific information
The memory state at time t, representing the current configuration of the unified agent memory system
The space of admissible memory configurations, defining valid states the memory system can occupy
A possible representation format for the memory state, storing information sequentially as text
A data structure that may be used to implement the memory system, allowing efficient storage and retrieval via keys
A type of database that stores data as vectors, enabling similarity-based retrieval in the memory system
A structural representation that can model relationships within memory, potentially used in hybrid memory forms
Information in the memory state derived from prior task executions, enabling knowledge transfer across trials
Newly acquired information during task execution, relevant only to the current task context
The conceptual framework describing how memory is formed, evolves, and is retrieved in the system
The initial creation or initialization of memory entries, either from prior experience or new inputs
The process by which memory changes over time through accumulation and updates during task execution
The act of accessing stored memory content when needed for decision-making or reasoning
The process by which an agent transforms informational artifacts into memory candidates for potential future use
Outputs generated by an agent at time t, including tool outputs, reasoning traces, plans, evaluations, or feedback
Function F that selectively transforms informational artifacts into memory candidates based on potential utility
Function E that integrates memory candidates into the memory base by consolidating, resolving conflicts, or discarding low-utility content
The memory state at time step t, representing the agent's accumulated knowledge before update
The set of memory candidates formed at time t+1 after applying the formation operator
The updated memory state at time t+1 after evolution and integration of new memory candidates
Researchers who contributed to understanding memory consolidation in AI systems
Researchers who studied conflict resolution in memory systems
Researchers who investigated conflict resolution mechanisms in evolving memory structures
Researchers who explored methods for discarding low-utility information in memory management
The persistent state of information maintained by an agent across decision steps and tasks
Process of creating or updating memory, such as retaining high-value information or discarding low-utility data
Process by which memory changes over time, including restructuring for efficient access
Mechanism for accessing context-dependent memory content during action selection
Function that constructs a task-aware query and returns relevant memory content based on current observation and memory state
Large language model used by the agent to generate actions, consuming retrieved memory as input
Researcher(s) who proposed methods for discarding low-utility information in agent memory systems
Schedule or condition under which memory operators are applied, influencing agent behavior and efficiency
Initial phase of a task where setup operations, such as one-time memory retrieval, may occur
The process of accessing memory, performed only at task initialization in some systems
The beginning phase of a task where setup processes, including initial memory retrieval, occur
The process by which observations are accumulated or transformed into patterns in memory
Basic, unprocessed data points collected during task execution and potentially stored in memory
Abstracted or refined knowledge derived from raw observations for efficient reuse across tasks
Temporary memory effects arising from recent interactions, either through logging or iterative refinement
Persistent memory updated episodically or continuously, supporting learning and adaptation over time
A simple method of recording interactions to support short-term memory, as used in Yao et al. (2023b) and Chen et al. (2023a)
An advanced memory mechanism involving repeated improvement of representations, as in Hu et al. (2025a)
Researchers who studied lightweight logging approaches for short-term memory in AI systems
Researchers contributing to the understanding of short-term memory via logging mechanisms
Researchers developing iterative refinement methods for memory evolution in intelligent agents
Time-based dynamics governing when and how memory is formed, retrieved, and updated
